thread.title: Pokemon GO is Teaming Up With Walmart - OpenCritic
thread.title_full: Pokemon GO is Teaming Up With Walmart - OpenCritic

title: Pokemon GO is Teaming Up With Walmart - OpenCritic
text: Pokemon GO has announced a partnership with Walmart that will add more PokeStops and Gyms to all Walmart Supercenters across the United States and put Pokemon GO gift cards into Walmart stores. This partnership looks to expand players' access to locations that can serve as gathering hubs for their local [Pokemon GO](https://gamerant.com/db/video-game/pokemon-go/) communities, and it is the first time that physical gift cards have been made available. PokeStops and Gyms have been present in Pokemon GO since its release in 2016. While the functionalities of these points-of-interest have changed over the years, [PokeStops](https://gamerant.com/pokemon-go-player-pokestop-discovery-shiny-weedle-waypoint-photo/) and Gyms still play very important roles in Pokemon GO, and many players interact with them frequently. A Pokemon GO player receives a very confusing push notification from the augmented reality game that leaves them with a few questions. The partnership between Pokemon GO and Walmart should make it easier for players to perform those interactions, as it will put PokeStops and Gyms at every Walmart Supercenter in the United States starting on October 20, 2024. As per the announcement of the partnership, 90 percent of Americans live within 10 miles of a Walmart store, which means that these new PokeStops and Gyms will serve...
